intro: Vaccaria hispanica, commonly known as Spanish Catchfly, is a low-growing annual plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It features small, white flowers with five petals and is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers bloom from late spring to early summer. It produces small, round seed capsules that release tiny seeds when mature. Vaccaria hispanica is also known for its medicinal uses in traditional herbal remedies.
